subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: The nature of things!
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0231_01CA216E.9DCA9920
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

"Just because speech is all perception does not make invalid--that even nor=
mal speech is highly subjective. If you used the rules of these scienctists=
, you couldn't even trust what the guy sitting next to you was saying. You =
couldn't trust what you were hearing!"

You're right....and I don't LOL! Al=
l I hope to be able to do is find proof of actual spirit communication. I d=
on't care so much about what is being communicated, only that it is.

-----=
---------------------------------------------------------------------------=



"Even it was all imagination, that does not make it invalid or useless. =
It's still serves as personal insight. "

I absolutely agree.

  ----- Orig=
inal Message ----- 
  From: purplespacefriend 
  To: EVP-ITC@...=
m 
  Sent: Thursday, August 20, 2009 7:55 AM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: The n=
ature of things!


    I think the mind is not physical, and it's only thes=
e paranoid scientist types that try to bully everyone into that extrememly =
narrow thinking that everything experienced is physical phenomenon only, an=
d must be made to fit into that context. 

  Just because speech is all per=
ception does not make invalid--that even normal speech is highly subjective=
. If you used the rules of these scienctists, you couldn't even trust what =
the guy sitting next to you was saying. You couldn't trust what you were he=
aring!

  Perception is everything. How is it that just before some mass de=
ath thing, like a plane crash or some disaster I see the shadows shift, it =
should not be possible, but never the less, I've seen it happen over and ov=
er. These scientific types brain wash everyone into not looking at clouds a=
s you might imagine you see something--well a day or two before tornados in=
 other states I see circles in the clouds here-hundreds of miles away. Peop=
le see me looking up and look at me like I'm insane because of these bully =
skeptics. You're not allowed to perceive anything unless they tell you it's=
 ok. You can't look at clouds, and you can't listen to voices fragments, cu=
z they can't explain away the perceptions. These scientist types are too br=
ain dead to realize they too create thier reality-all those supposed new pa=
rticals did not exist before someone theorized about them, then they are cr=
eated and "discovered". 

  Even it was all imagination, that does not make=
 it invalid or useless. It's still serves as personal insight. 

  frank-S
=

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...> wrote:
  =
>
  > Assumptions and expectations!? I hear a lot of both of these concepts=
 in your words and when mentioning your research. Cognitive functioning or =
processing sensory information in order to come to a conclusion or judgemen=
t is how we function in this world. In order for your mind to understand th=
is physical world you live in it automatically makes certain assumptions ab=
out sensory information it takes in. Your eyes expect to see objects orient=
ed correctly, with the correct color, lighting, reflectivity and shading, a=
nd you expect there size and shape to be within scale compared to other obj=
ects. My point is your senses have a range, which implies limitations. Sinc=
e this is correct for your senses it is also correct for your ability to un=
derstand perspectives with any wide ranging diversity. You are able to see =
and process the information of our physical world just as any other human b=
eing does. That is great for a human but why would you think for a second,
=
  > you could understand the perspective of a mind and  voice that speaks t=
hrough a radio from some unknown location.
  >  
  > The information you re=
ceive from the other side of your radios or even from thin air through EVP'=
s could be completely correct and true no matter what the context because y=
ou don't know what perspective it is coming from. You are making a lot of u=
nfounded assumptions about the (dare I say) beings or worlds they exist in =
and have a lot of expectations about the information you receive. You are l=
ooking for answers to the wrong questions! Quit assuming that these entitie=
s know you or the people around you. Quit assuming they are here for your e=
ntertainment as a personal fortune teller. Quit expecting them to know answ=
ers to question they may have themselves (just because they aren't physical=
 doesn't mean they know everything). Don't assume you will be speaking to a=
 dead relative or someone you once knew. Go to a fortune teller if you want=
 information about the furture. If you are serious about researching these =
voices and the equipment used to record them
  > then ask the right questio=
ns. 
  >  
  > If you have a box made by Frank then ask Frank how the diffe=
rent circuits work, what is the puropose of some of the options, why is the=
 RVG better or worse than a circuit without it? You have a unique situation=
 here where the inventor of an important piece of equipment is willing to s=
hare the most minute details of how it works without a price tag attached. =
Some of the other box variations are sold by one person but created by some=
one else and usually based on some loose design similar to Frank's. The oth=
er equipment made by Bill Chapp and others will probably stay a mystery bec=
ause they are sold for profit. Most people who use the different "hacks" kn=
ow how to make them but don't know much about electronic theory or the beha=
vior of radio waves to understand how they work.
  >  
  > Point is you hav=
e plenty of questions to ask the human's who have built the equipment you a=
re using before you can even begin to ask questions of the entities you are=
 communicating with.
  >  
  > Regards,
  >  
  > Frank R.
  >
